meanings.definition: The natural features of a landscape, considered in terms of their appearance.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful scenery of the mountains took my breath away.
meanings.sent2: We enjoyed the scenery during our hike through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The scenery looked like a painting come to life.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were a scenery of emotions, each one vivid and striking.
meanings.sent5: The scenery of the beach at sunset was etched in my memory forever.

meanings.definition: The painted background used to represent natural features or other surroundings on a theater stage.
meanings.sent1: The actors performed in front of a stunning scenery of a castle.
meanings.sent2: The theater crew worked hard to create the perfect scenery for the play.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the scenery suddenly fell down, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: The scenery on stage transformed magically, transporting the audience to a different world.
meanings.sent5: The detailed scenery added depth and realism to the theatrical production.

meanings.definition: The general appearance of a place.
meanings.sent1: The city's scenery was a mix of old and new buildings.
meanings.sent2: The scenery of the park was peaceful and inviting.
meanings.sent3: The scenery of the town changed dramatically after the festival decorations went up.
meanings.sent4: The scenery of the restaurant was cozy and welcoming.
meanings.sent5: The scenery of the hotel lobby was elegant and grand.
